page.title: 02ATTITUDES - GOOD OLD DAYS
page.content: Two young girls listened to the memories of an elderly lady. At school the teachers were very strict. Children were seen and not heard. The lady's favourite subject was reading but she hated sewing. The Strood Fair came to Station Road once a year. For two pennies you could go on almost everything. With her friends she played games like whip and top and hoop and stick. She lived near the dreaded workhouse where homeless, ill, or disabled people were sent. If she went out with a boy she would not dare to tell her mother or else! When she was 16 she had to be in by nine oclock or else! In 1985 she thinks the community spirit has gone and life is more hostile. Bring back the good old days in Rochester!
